oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-12-26 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 26, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Zeke Clements, Art Wooten, Minnie Pearl, Pap's Jug Band, Ford Rush, and the John Daniel Quartet. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rachel Veach; Zeke Clements; Bashful Brother Oswald
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louie Buck introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys with Rachel Veach -- Living On The Mountain, Baby Mine (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Rachel Veach) -- George D. Hay introduces Zeke Clements -- There's A Star-Spangled Banner Waving Somewhere (Zeke Clements) -- George D. Hay introduces Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald -- Southern Moon (Rachel Veach, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Things That Might Have Been (Roy Acuff)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Acuff, Roy; John Daniel Quartet; Pap's Jug Band; Wilson, Lonnie; Minnie Pearl; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Wooten, Art, 1906-1986; Clements, Zeke
